channel.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
channel.description:
(Sorry for the new topic but the battle-x thread is locked) It looks like I am some kind of unofficial rsc moderator or something? After the thread advertisement got removed I got a few messages on skype and moparscape regarding the subject. I thought I would post this thread because I haven't played any private server in quite some time. If somebody did look into the client, possibly shed some light on the subject so people have a heads up. I do know that the last time keith infected people it was a simple keylogger which he blamed one of his developers for.
Hi, I played The Djinn's ("Keith's") server "Battle-X" for quite sometime, and I'm trying to clean my comp ASAP of any malicious content due to the mod warning. What exactly were his past infringements? Is he known to put keyloggers in his clients or something, and is there knowledge of him stealing passwords/information/etc? Just curious, thanks.
Hey dood I played battlex and need to know about malicious files on my computer hallp.
Do private servers give viruses?
If someone could kindly pm me a dl link for the 'malicious client' so I could look into it, that would be great... At this time everyone should do a virus scan.

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Gonna go back to what I said before, Luke is no longer the owner of RSCE so why does it matter? Also, I’ve been receiving a few pms from a staff member from battle-x and after they had proven that it isn’t malicious I’ve given them the all clear to post an advertisement for it again since the only real reason the last one was removed is because the OP was supposed to be banned.

Gonna go ahead and lock this too since its been derailed, spammed, swallowed up by a tornado and then derailed again.

Read full topic

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @Dustin_Jr Dustin Jr
item.description:
@Dustin_Jr wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:37, topic:521579”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=640090.msg4315139#msg4315139 date=1371362312]

i can confirm a lot of RSC money went towards luke’s bike, so what Rodgerwilco said about RSC caused his death is true in a sense.
[/quote]Like RSCShadow said, where’s your source.

i used to talk to him on irc dev channel & msn, we would talk about bikes and donations when i was an admin at RSCE. his new bike was funded by RSC money.

pix or it didnt happen[/quote]

lol all of you are idiots, im sure if pyru wasn’t such a kiss ass he would openly tell you also that luke did this numerous of times…

I can give you personal stories, Luke would tell me he was spawning sub cards, selling them for usd, buying them back for spawned gp and selling them back so there was not a lot circulating, also he created many stakers for people setting stats, selling 99 stats numerous times… told me if i wanted hed sell me 99 flats for 100 usd. this was within the first 3 months of the server…

All of you luke dick suckers are annoying, he was a shitty person, he thought of no1 but himself and his money, how to make more money and how to make him self look like a great guy in the process. He tried to do so much shit behind everyones back. He banned sara for corruption and demoted her etc, for the same shit he did every fuckin day… People are so fuckin dumb and naive. Pyru sells phats, and if your on his good side, you get them cheap and any color you want. even if the site says they are out of them… Mod crack has been caught selling mills by a few people and it gets swept under the rug… ex mod money unbanned mikko and got away with it, and of course it would have been seen on the mod logs but mikko came forward, or he would have got away with it…

I scammed vezl over 2B and pyru didn’t say shit, because he knew vezl was a piece of shit, vezl posted all over the forums that day for hours and i was sitting with over 20 hats + 5 canes, and 25 + dmed sq sets… and every other rare there was 2x of them. I know i stole 1m airs fires, and 50k deaths and 25k bloods…

Pyru claimed he didn’t know… lol i didn’t proxy… i checked stork-pk replicas db, saw snus password, tried it on rsce, logged on about 10 accounts and boom… Also there was no evidence of vezl botting etc.

He had over 5m+ total airs fires, and over 150k + deaths bloods… had over 2k rune sets, If i would of screenied the bank you would of thought he had bought lukes bike for him.

Read full topic

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There have been some servers that were around for a while, but I’m betting they managed to acquire funding for things like DDoS protection ahead of time, before they needed it.
Now that attacks seem to be a certainty, the person financing the server needs to operate out of pocket from the beginning.

So in short, it’s very expensive for people to operate new servers these days for public use. I suspect most servers wouldn’t generate any income through subscriptions or donations until they have been up for three to six months. That’s anywhere from $1500 to $4000 in DDoS protected hosting which has to come out of someone’s pocket.

To be honest, the only way running a server can be viable now is with mandatory subscription fees. If 200 players payed just $5 per month, that’d cover the cost. But I doubt there are 200 players prepared to do that.

Read full topic

[/quote]java drive by, etc,.[/quote]What exactly is the point of this post? By the way, when people say et cetera they typically list more than one example of what they are explaining, to allow the read to form a pattern.

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Do I really have to spoon feed you obvious information? https://www.facebook.com/projectrsc/likes They would invest a consistent amount of time into rsc under the right scenario. I will not go into further detail here. Maybe skype or irc.
Only about 100-150 of those likes are real. We paid to have the page liked to increase traffic. Same thing with the Twitter account.

This isn’t called “spoon-feeding”, it’s sourcing your information.

Negativity, like usual. On prsc facebook page it shows the average age from 18-24. It wouldn't take too long to teach the older age group but with those stats most of the kids were 10-14 probably younger when they got to play. How would you out reach to the younger audience? Or do you not want them because they can't provide donations via paypal? The term private server isn't really friendly as people don't know who is behind it or the potential viruses involved. Most people who never played a private server of anything think of the immediate risks.
You mean honesty? If you have to make a huge effort to teach people and explain to them every detail, it's not worth it and it's unlikely that it would pick up.
PRSC had problems before it even started. Everyone who knew two cents about the scene knew the intentions of that server. Why would we bother? Luke died, hurry up jump onto bandwagon of creating a server. xEnt has continuously bitched about luke being in control of the community for years so when he got the opportunity he 'joined' your project. We can talk more about prsc and the reasons it failed if you want to talk about it.
We were always thinking of starting a server, and wanted to do something to keep people happy and try out some of our new ideas. xEnt didn't contribute as much to the server as you might be thinking (he did help to fix bugs when it was starting). It just failed because it was sold to someone who quit not too long after he bought it. That's all there is to it.
The evidence was provided years ago but everyone who is in power defends rsce. Conspiracy.
If you can't provide any evidence then I'm not going to believe you, and nobody else should either.
Jagex made the decision to bury it when it was at it's prime. The demand for players is still there. You can look at the rsc section and see over 1000+ potential unique posts based on usernames. Even this http://pastebin.com/Pwe1DBgd little bring back rsc support brought in 2700+ people since 2009.
If the demand was still there it would have been demanded to stay open when they opened it recently. The online count dropped dramatically after the first few days and the interest was lost.

Read full topic

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

tigerclan:

When RSC was actually still ran by jagex before rs2, there were sites that had malicious content, saying they were cheats for RSC, as well as people making bs bots that stole your passwords. Even with this malicious content, they still managed to have 1200 people on world 1 and at least 3 other worlds half full all day pretty much. So you can pretty much sugarcoat it however the fuck you want. RSC is dead. <- That’s a period aka /thread

Can you explain to me how that has anything to do with a price of a private server being extremely expensive to what it should cost? “Before” RS2 meaning the 2002-2003 era? You’re kidding… in 2002 they were managing 10,000 online at a time. In 2003 I remember 20,000+. Let’s also mention that most of those players were legitimate players.

RSCShadow:

If it were an obvious classic, then there would be more demand for playing it and Jagex’s attempts to restart it would have been successful.

Jagex made the decision to bury it when it was at it’s prime. The demand for players is still there. You can look at the rsc section and see over 1000+ potential unique posts based on usernames. Even this http://pastebin.com/Pwe1DBgd little bring back rsc support brought in 2700+ people since 2009.

RSCShadow:

What do you even mean by this? What conflict by which server owners? Obviously server owners aren’t going to be supporting eachother’s servers, that’s why it’s a competition.

Do I need to pull a list of everyone who has a ran a server and which ddossed who or which one exploited the others webpage etc etc. The only person who suffers from this is the players. I’ll put up rscangel and rsce since a lot of development got done during that battle. YES, greats thing for the rsc private server community but horrible for players. Especially with a lot of new players rscangel brought in and the server being shutdown, they won’t invest that time ever again.

RSCShadow:

There’s nothing you can do about that, it’d be a problem anywhere. It has nothing to do with why people don’t play RSC, there have been plenty of servers that have been up for long periods of time.

A lot of people don’t play rsc because they know a server will be shutdown as soon as it’s too expensive to continue. I remember running a server on my home pc and holding 180 at one point. You just can’t do it anymore. With limited up time you have limited growth. Can you provide a server that has been up a long period of time and failed to tally in a good amount of players. We can discuss other reasons to why it failed.

RSCShadow:

I’d love to see some stats on this instead of just random numbers you pull out of your ass. What evidence do you have that new players would invest a consistent amount of time in RSC?

Do I really have to spoon feed you obvious information? https://www.facebook.com/projectrsc/likes
They would invest a consistent amount of time into rsc under the right scenario. I will not go into further detail here. Maybe skype or irc.

RSCShadow:

Yes the game isn’t intuitive at all and appeals to an extremely small audience. It’s not a “classic” and people aren’t interested in playing it because it’s outdated. You can really only appeal to the nostalgia. It would take too long to try and convince and teach new players to play it if the game doesn’t look appealing.

Negativity, like usual. On prsc facebook page it shows the average age from 18-24. It wouldn’t take too long to teach the older age group but with those stats most of the kids were 10-14 probably younger when they got to play. How would you out reach to the younger audience? Or do you not want them because they can’t provide donations via paypal? The term private server isn’t really friendly as people don’t know who is behind it or the potential viruses involved. Most people who never played a private server of anything think of the immediate risks.

RSCShadow:

PRSC was just as easy to get running as real RS. There was a simple webclient link on the front page and all you needed to do was register. I’m pretty sure this is the same case with RSCE and other private servers.

PRSC had problems before it even started. Everyone who knew two cents about the scene knew the intentions of that server. Why would we bother? Luke died, hurry up jump onto bandwagon of creating a server. xEnt has continuously bitched about luke being in control of the community for years so when he got the opportunity he ‘joined’ your project.
We can talk more about prsc and the reasons it failed if you want to talk about it.

RSCShadow:

Do you actually have any evidence to support this or are you just relying on rumours/hearsay?

The evidence was provided years ago but everyone who is in power defends rsce. Conspiracy.

Read full topic

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

The game is 12 years but was built on a great foundation. Monsters to kill, quests to complete, it's an obvious classic and has potential but with a limited mind set, you have a limited game.
If it were an obvious classic, then there would be more demand for playing it and Jagex's attempts to restart it would have been successful.
The private server community is dead because of server owners attempting to be head dicks of the 'community'.
It's always been this way. There has always been a conflict with server owners and the people who pay the price are the players. Competition is good for new innovations but is limited in the rsc scene. Do I really need to explain this?
What do you even mean by this? What conflict by which server owners? Obviously server owners aren't going to be supporting eachother's servers, that's why it's a competition.
Lothy has pointed out before, it's rather expensive to host a simple server now a days due to trolls.
There's nothing you can do about that, it'd be a problem anywhere. It has nothing to do with why people don't play RSC, there have been plenty of servers that have been up for long periods of time.
Looking at facebook, twitter and other social media websites you can poll in about 2,000+ potential previous players. Since most of them have played a private server before, why would they waste their time? I'll go back to head dicks of the community and blame them for this one. You can also reach out to new players who have never played before but it would be extremely difficult with your attitudes.
I'd love to see some stats on this instead of just random numbers you pull out of your ass. What evidence do you have that new players would invest a consistent amount of time in RSC?
The community is not friendly. New people don't know how the game works. New players are discouraged when they don't understand the combat system.
Yes the game isn't intuitive at all and appeals to an extremely small audience. It's not a "classic" and people aren't interested in playing it because it's outdated. You can really only appeal to the nostalgia. It would take too long to try and convince and teach new players to play it if the game doesn't look appealing.
Obviously everyone who has played the game before gets the drift but what private server website has actually gone out of it's way to make the scene newbie friendly? There is an obvious wall. A lot of people don't even have 7zip or rar when they stumble upon a rsc community.
PRSC was just as easy to get running as real RS. There was a simple webclient link on the front page and all you needed to do was register. I'm pretty sure this is the same case with RSCE and other private servers.
Even with his server he would put money on an account and sell it off like he was a gold seller. He always found a way to obtain money and in the end it resulted in his death. All the money he took from the rsc community went to his bike, so in a way.. rsc scamming caused his death.
Do you actually have any evidence to support this or are you just relying on rumours/hearsay?

Read full topic

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

[quote=tigerclan]rsc is dead because it’s 12 years old

The game is 12 years but was built on a great foundation. Monsters to kill, quests to complete, it’s an obvious classic and has potential but with a limited mind set, you have a limited game.

The private server community is dead because of server owners attempting to be head dicks of the ‘community’.

It’s always been this way. There has always been a conflict with server owners and the people who pay the price are the players. Competition is good for new innovations but is limited in the rsc scene. Do I really need to explain this?

Lothy has pointed out before, it’s rather expensive to host a simple server now a days due to trolls.

Same as above, ddossing and other malicious activity.

There is plenty of interest in rsc servers but none show potential. Everyone (who has played a server before)already gets the drift so they don’t invest their time. I’d also like to add that for a new person coming into this community it’s very difficult for obvious reasons.

Looking at facebook, twitter and other social media websites you can poll in about 2,000+ potential previous players. Since most of them have played a private server before, why would they waste their time? I’ll go back to head dicks of the community and blame them for this one. You can also reach out to new players who have never played before but it would be extremely difficult with your attitudes.

I’d also like to add that for a new person coming into this community it’s very difficult for obvious reasons.

The community is not friendly.
New people don’t know how the game works.
New players are discouraged when they don’t understand the combat system.
Obviously everyone who has played the game before gets the drift but what private server website has actually gone out of it’s way to make the scene newbie friendly? There is an obvious wall. A lot of people don’t even have 7zip or rar when they stumble upon a rsc community.

I won’t even bother to quote the stuff about luke since we all already know that story.[/quote]

When RSC was actually still ran by jagex before rs2, there were sites that had malicious content, saying they were cheats for RSC, as well as people making bs bots that stole your passwords. Even with this malicious content, they still managed to have 1200 people on world 1 and at least 3 other worlds half full all day pretty much. So you can pretty much sugarcoat it however the fuck you want. RSC is dead. <- That’s a period aka /thread

Read full topic

item.title: "Battle-X" Malicious
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Dustin Jr, post:10, topic:521579”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=640090.msg4314300#msg4314300 date=1371201215]
The only reason I included that in the lock post is because of his past issues with the rat in the client etc. It might not be true this time but its better to be safe than sorry I would say!
[/quote]

So why is rscemulation left open, back in the day luke scammed 100’s of mills + a lot of other shady stuff, hacked numerous people. Seems this site plays favorites.[/quote]
Completely false, you’re just picking an argument now. Luke is no longer the owner of RSCE so why should that server be removed for a past owners mistakes when this Keith directly harmed the population of this site and was banned permanently for it. You have no credible argument so just don’t post about it, simple.
